system.description:
It creates false gold coins, 1d6 in number, which look genuine until disappearing with the next cockcrow. One can reach into the purse a second time, but there is a 1:6 probability all coins disappear at once; on the third try, this chance is 1:3; and afterwards, 1:2. Those who keep the gold for long often believe they have lost it or been pickpocketed – but the earlier they lose it, the easier they become suspicious.

Component: a silk purse stuffed with fool’s gold. It also works with goat’s crap, but it shall remain behind in the mark’s pocket or cashbox.
